title: Compton scattering - photons on Al target

content.question:
Two incident photons move in the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction toward an aluminum target, as shown. Each photon and an electron in the target interact.
One resulting photon moves in a direction that is <math alttext="60 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>60</mn><mo>°</mo></math> above the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction after the interaction, as shown. The difference in the wavelength between the resulting photon and the incident photon is <math alttext="delta lambda sub 60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>60</mn></msub></math>.
The other resulting photon moves in a direction that is <math alttext="120 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>120</mn><mo>°</mo></math> above the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction after the interaction, as shown. The difference in the wavelength between the resulting photon and the incident photon is <math alttext="delta lambda sub 120" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>120</mn></msub></math>.
Which expression is equal to <math alttext="delta lambda sub 120" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>120</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="one third delta lambda sub 60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>60</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="one half delta lambda sub 60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>60</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="2 delta lambda sub 60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>60</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="3 delta lambda sub 60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>60</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="3 delta lambda sub 60" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>3</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>60</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
